Title: Colophon
Medium: ink and pigments on cream-colored, watermarked laid European paper
Inscriptions: [Transliteration] tamma al-kitāb al-mustatāb bi-'awn Allāh al-malik al-wahhāb /1/ 'alá yad al-'abd al-mudhnib al-faqīr al-faqīr al-muhtāj ilá rahmat rabbih al-qadīr /2/ Mustafá ibn al-Hājj Muhammad fī awāsit Jumādá al-ākhirah /3/ li-sanat ihdá wa-thamānīn wa-alf min hijrah man lahu al-'izz wa-al-sharaf /4/
Description: This folio from Walters manuscript W.585 contains a colophon written obliquely on the right side of the frame. The colophon contains the name of the scribe and the date of copying.
Keywords: Arabic; Islamic; Ottoman; Turkish; Book; Codex; Illumination; Manuscript; Ornament; Contemporary Binding; Turkey; Sufism
Provenance: Muhammad ibn Zadah al-Ayyubi, 1117 AH/AD 1705 [mode of acquisition unknown] [ex libiris fol. 1a]; Vizier al-Shahid 'Ali Pasha, 1130 AH/AD 1717 (?) [mode of acquisition unknown] [waqf seal of the Vizier on fol. 1a (erased) and on fol. 210b dated 1130 AH/AD 1717 with former shelf mark 1173]; 'Ali [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [ex libiris fol. 1a]; Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: 'Ali Dede al-Busnawi (died 1007 AH/AD 1598)
